subject: Productivity
title: The Ivy Lee Method
description: A quick, practical guide to The Ivy Lee Method.

hook.text: In 1918, a consultant gave steel magnate Charles Schwab one simple productivity trick.

buildup.text: Ivy Lee told Schwab: each night, write six tasks for tomorrow. Rank them. Start with number one.

discovery.text: Schwab's executives tried it for three months. Productivity soared. Schwab paid Lee $25,000.

twist.text: The method has no app, no system, no framework. Its power comes from forcing a single priority.

climax.text: Over a century later, the Ivy Lee method remains one of the most effective planning tools.

quiz.question: What is the core rule of the Ivy Lee Method?
options: Write six tasks each night and rank them by priority
Complete ten tasks before lunch every day
Delegate all tasks to other people
